name: Finish the Great Country Title Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Finish the title: "May The Bird of Paradise Fly Up Your ______"
questions.explanation:
Nose.

	This was a number 1 hit for Little Jimmy Dickens, who stood a mere 4' 11". He was elected to the Country Music Hall of Fame in 1982.  Other hits by Little Jimmy Dickens were "Take an Old Cold 'Tater(And Wait)", "Country Boy", and "Hillbilly Fever".

questions.text: Finish the title: "If I Said You Had A Beautiful Body, Would You _____ It Against Me"
questions.explanation:
hold.

	This was a number 1 song for The Bellamy Brothers in 1979.  Brothers David and Howard had other hits such as "Dancin' Cowboys", "Redneck Girls", and "Old Hippie".  David Bellamy wrote the song "Spider and Snakes" for Jim Stafford.

questions.text: Finish the title: "She's Acting Single (I'm Drinking ________)"
questions.explanation:
Doubles.

	This was a number 1 song for Gary Stewart in 1975.  Other hits by Gary Stewart were "Out of Hand" and "Oh, Sweet Temptation".

Denial.

	This song went to number 11 in 1993 for Pam Tillis, daughter of Mel Tillis. She was named CMA Female Vocalist of the Year in 1994. Other hits by Pam were "Mi Vida Loca (My Crazy Life)", "Maybe It Was Memphis", and "Spilled Perfume".

questions.text: Finish the title:  "All My Exes Live In ___________"
questions.explanation:
Texas.

	This was a number 1 song by George Strait in 1983.  This song and many other of George Strait's hits can be found on his boxed set entitled "Out of the Box".  George Strait made his movie debut in "Pure Country", where he played a singer who was tired of the business and went into hiding.

questions.text: Finish the title:  "I Was Country When Country Wasn't _______"
questions.explanation:
Cool.

	This was a number 1 song for Barbara Mandrell in 1981. Barbara was named CMA Entertainer of the Year for 1980 and 1981.  She had her own TV show with sisters Louise and Irlene from 1980 to 1982. She was in a very serious accident in 1984, and she claims the only reason she survived was because she had her seat belt on.

questions.text: Finish the title: "Rockin' With The Rhythm Of The _______"
questions.explanation:
Rain.

	This was a number 1 song for The Judds in 1986. The Judds consist of Mother Naomi and Daughter Wynonna.  The Judds won the CMA's Horizon Award, given for best new act, in 1984 and have won four Vocal Duo of the Year awards and three Vocal Group of the Year awards. Wynonna's sister is actress Ashley Judd.

questions.text: Finish the title: "Take This Job And ________ It"
questions.explanation:
Shove.

	This was a number 1 song for Johnny Paycheck in 1977.  This song was the basis for a 1981 movie starring Art Carney and Robert Hays.  He wrote "Apartment number 9" for Tammy Wynette.

questions.text: Finish the title to this Pinkard and Bowden song: "Mama, She's _______"
questions.explanation:
Lazy.

	This song was a takeoff of The Judd's number 1 song "Mama, He's Crazy" and Pinkard and Bowden took it to number 39 in 1984.

questions.text: Finish the title: "She Got the Goldmine (And I Got the _______)"
questions.explanation:
Shaft.

	This was a number 1 song for Jerry Reed in 1982.  Jerry Reed has appeared in the movies "W.W. and the Dixie Dancekings", "Smoky and the Bandit", and "Gator".
